question: how much copper is it ok for a 2 year old to eat?
question_content: I just saw my son eat about 50 pennies that i had sitting on the kitchen table, im concerned and i need to know should i give him laxatives or will the copper just go through his system.

answers.answer_content:
Call poison control or take him straight to the emergency room.

Pennies are not copper.  They are a lot of zinc with a little bit of copper.

Zinc and stomach acid is a very bad combination.  One penny will not be a serious problem for a two year old, but 50 pennies is a serious dose of zinc for any size child.

This is not a joke.  Call poison control.  This is a real medical emergency.  Poison control will explain this to you.  1-800-222-1222

Call right now.  Stop messing around online.  Please don't listen to random people online.  Let the poison control experts help you.  Don't just wait to see what happens.  By the time his stomach perforates from the zinc chloride that is created in his stomach, it will be too late.  Call poison control.  1-800-222-1222

Call 911 immediately!  Pennies aren't even made of copper; they're made mostly out of zinc now.  You state that you sat and watched him eat 50 pennies, which would take a very long time.  
I have some serious doubts about your question because anyone with half a brain would have stopped him before he ate them all and if it is true, you would have him in the ER by now.

Well, No child should eat copper, 
But you can either give him laxatives. Or you can watch him and see how he reacts,
But to be sure you can give him lacitives for self reassurance, just keep an eye n him.
